title: Jarome Luai
text:
Jarome Luai (born 16 January 1997) is an <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Born Maori</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a or for the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> with whom he won the <a href="2021%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">2021 NRL Premiership</a>. 
Luai represented <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> at the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2017 World Cup</a>.
Background.
Luai was born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>, of <a href="Samoans">Samoan</a> descent through his paternal grandparents (who are from <a href="Palauli">Palauli</a>), and <a href="M%C4%81ori%20people">Māori</a> descent through his mother.
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="St%20Marys%20Saints">St Marys Saints</a> before being signed by the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
Luai played 33 games for the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> in the <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> between 2015 and 2017, scoring 13 tries and kicking 43 goals. Luai spent part of the 2017 season playing for Penrith in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a>. Luai captained the <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a> in May 2017, scoring a try in their 4622 loss to the <a href="Junior%20Kangaroos">Junior Kangaroos</a>. At the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2017 World Cup</a>, Luai was the only member of the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoan</a> squad without any prior NRL experience. He speculated on his selection, saying "I think you'll find <a href="Tyrone%20May">Tyrone May</a> was in the squad originally but due to his injury there was a spot for me." Luai made his Test debut against <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tonga</a> on 4 November 2017.
2018.
Following an injury to <a href="Nathan%20Cleary">Nathan Cleary</a>, Luai was named to make his NRL debut off the interchange bench in round 4 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a>. However, he was cut from the line-up on gameday in favour of <a href="Wayde%20Egan">Wayde Egan</a>, who was also on debut. Luai made his NRL debut in round 10 against the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>, playing for 26 minutes off the interchange bench. In round 17, Luai started at in his second NRL match in the absence of <a href="Nathan%20Cleary">Nathan Cleary</a> and <a href="James%20Maloney%20%28rugby%20league%29">James Maloney</a> due to <a href="2018%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">State of Origin</a>. His performance in the 364 win, which included two tries and multiple try assists, was heavily praised by the media.
2019.
Luai made 13 appearances for Penrith in the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a> as the club finished 10th on the table and missed the finals for the first time in four years. Luai also represented <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> playing <a href="Hooker%20%28rugby%20league%29">hooker</a> in their 24-6 win over PNG. And played <a href="Halfback%20%28rugby%20league%29">halfback</a> in their 44-18 lose to <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Fiji</a>.
2020.
Luai had a breakout year for Penrith playing 23 games, scoring seven tries and bagging 23 try assists as the Penrith club claimed the <a href="Minor%20Premiership">Minor Premiership</a> and reached the <a href="2020%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">2020 NRL Grand Final</a>. Luai played in the grand final against the Melbourne Storm, losing 2620. Luai's form throughout the season was rewarded with a spot in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> <a href="State%20of%20Origin%20series">State of Origin</a> 27 man squad although he did not play in the three game series.
2021.
On 30 May, he was selected by New South Wales for game 1 of the <a href="2021%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">2021 State of Origin series</a>.
Luai made his debut for New South Wales in game 1 where they defeated Queensland 50-6. On the 27th June, Luai was a part of the NSW side which defeated Queensland 26-0, sealing the series for 2021. However, Luai was ruled out of game three of the series after he suffered a knee injury in Penrith's round 16 win over the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>. 
Luai played a total of 25 games for Penrith in the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a> including the club's <a href="2021%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">2021 NRL Grand Final</a> victory over <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a>.
